sessions.title: Application testing and Continuous Integration with Genymotion
Hand's on Web Components with Polymer 1.0
sessions.desc:
The W3C has been working on a Web Components standard for almost three years, but it is still a work in progress. But polyfills like allows current developers to use Web Components today, and incorporate to their apps widgets from any library of web components.

The best known of these libraries is Google's Polymer. In Google IO 2015 conference, Google has at last released the long awaited version 1.0 of Polymer, making it even faster, more stable and at least suitable for "serious" applications. In this lab you will use Polymer 1.0 with Material Design Polymer Elements to design and develop a web application using web components.

You will learn to use the following technologies:
  • Polymer and Web Components (for mobile and desktop)
  • The Paper Elements for Polymer (material design)


Mandatory Installs prior to lab:
  • npm
  • bower
  • your favorite HTML/CSS/JS IDE (I suggest Sublime Text)

So the opportunity we see in building our solution is how do we make a fundamental shift in the ratio between â€œmaintainâ€? and â€œinvestâ€?.
I want to show you what we are doing, and hopefully help you understand how you can make a difference with us.
Agility: Pivot to a different direction as needed. Scale fast and smoothly.

sessions.title: Management en couleur avec DISC
sessions.desc:
Chaque personne est unique. Chacun de nous voit le monde Ã sa faÃ§on. Chacun communique et se comporte dâ€™une maniÃ¨re qui lui est propre. Ce constat est unanimement admis. Pourtant, nous rÃ©pÃ©tons tous la mÃªme erreur de communication : nous parlons aux autres comme on aimerait quâ€™ils nous parlent. Cette erreur est essentielle. Il faut parler aux autres comme ils aimeraient quâ€™on leur parle. Une des rÃ¨gles dâ€™or est quâ€™il faut sâ€™adapter Ã son interlocuteur. Mais, pour cela, encore faut-il connaitre son profilâ€¦

DISC est un outil d'Ã©valuation (colorÃ©) utilisÃ© pour amÃ©liorer la productivitÃ©, le travail d'Ã©quipe et la communication. DISC est l'acronyme de Dominant (rouge), Influent (jaune), Stable (vert) et Consciencieux (bleu). DISC mesure des styles de communication et de comportement. Ce nâ€™est PAS un test de QI. Ã‡a ne mesure PAS lâ€™intelligence, les aptitudes, la santÃ© mentale, les valeurs, etc. Les profils DISC dÃ©crivent les comportements humains dans de nombreuses situations, par exemple en rÃ©ponse au stress, aux dÃ©fis, aux challenges, aux crises, aux procÃ©dures, etc.

En connaissant bien son profil et celui de ses interlocuteurs, on peut communiquer de maniÃ¨re plus efficace, Ã lâ€™Ã©crit comme Ã lâ€™oral. Cela permet de distribuer efficacement les tÃ¢ches selon leurs types, les objectifs, les besoins, les contraintes, etc. Cela permet Ã©galement de constituer une Ã©quipe en choisissant ses membres en fonction du contexte.

sessions.title: Advanced Scrolling Techniques on Android
sessions.desc: Scrolling is one of the most important gesture on mobile platforms. Indeed, it easily allows users to access a fairly large amount of content just by swiping their fingers on screen. In order to implement such gestures, the Android SDK comes with a bunch of scrolling containers: View, ListView, RecyclerView, ScrollView, etc. While using these components independently is relatively simple, it starts getting complicated when nesting themâ€¦ In this session we will go through a complete overview of how Android deals with scrolling in general and how to master the scrolling mechanism to create compelling mobile user experience.

sessions.title: Redefining PaaS: Managed container based microservices on Google App Engine
sessions.desc:
Microservices are a great model for developing modern applications. But microservice based architectures are more complicated than traditional monolithic apps and can come with a significant management overhead particularly when you need to maintain different environments for dev, test and production. This overhead either falls on your development team or to people you hire specifically to manage it.

This talk with multiple demos, looks at how to build, test and deploy container based microservice architectures without having to worry about managing the platform on which they run, thus freeing up your developers to do what they do best, writing application code.
We'll look at new and enhanced features of Google App Engine and walk through the staged deployment of both a simple application and a more complicated microservices based architecture. We'll also look at how App Engine has evolved from it's original sandboxed runtime environment to what it is today, a next generation platform for building and deploying modern day applications.

Je vous invite Ã m'accompagner pour une aventure ludique mÃªlant API web, science-fiction, hypermedia et culture du dÃ©veloppeur. Au travers d'un jeu d'aventure textuel un peu fou, je vous ferai dÃ©couvrir quelques techniques pour amÃ©liorer vos propres API web.

sessions.title: Power optimization for Android
sessions.desc:
Android devices running on battery need to be optimized for power. If just take a look on the CPU this optimization starts typically with the race to idle, meaning to go to finish the workload as fast as possible. However typical Android devices are running on a SoC with many parts included like CPU, GPU or Audio and Video decoder. All the parts need to be optimized to reduce the power consumption. The Android API provides a number of APIs to help with this and also a power profiling tool can help the developer to understand what hardware parts are active and where he needs to start optimization.

In the session we will discuss typical causes of high power consumption, how to debug them and provide possible solutions.

sessions.title: Graph clustering in Python
sessions.desc: Clustering of data in a way that will make use of inherent structural information is an increasingly important task for many data scientists. This talk will explore the challenges associated with clustering of complex networked data for the commercial application of search keyword optimisation. We'll take a look at several techniques and demonstrate some of them with the package iGraph, available to Python users. If time permits we shall round off by examining how to visualise the results in an interactive fashion.
